parameters.name: X1
parameters.description: x component of the lower corner of the clipping rectangle

parameters.name: Y1
parameters.description: y component of the lower corner of the clipping rectangle

parameters.name: X2
parameters.description: x component of the upper corner of the clipping rectangle

parameters.name: Y2
parameters.description: y component of the upper corner of the clipping rectangle

title: IModelDoc2.CreateClippedSplines
description: Creates one or more sketch spline segments that are clipped against a given (x1, y1), (x2, y2) rectangle. This rectangle lies in the space of the active 2D sketch.
signature:
System.Object CreateClippedSplines( 
   System.Object
ParamsIn
,
   System.Double
X1
,
   System.Double
Y1
,
   System.Double
X2
,
   System.Double
Y2
)

parameters.name: X1
parameters.description: x component of the lower corner of the clipping rectangle

parameters.name: Y1
parameters.description: y component of the lower corner of the clipping rectangle

parameters.name: X2
parameters.description: x component of the upper corner of the clipping rectangle

parameters.name: Y2
parameters.description: y component of the upper corner of the clipping rectangle

returns: Array of newly created sketch segments
remarks:
The rectangle lies in the space of the active 2D sketch. The results are undefined for calls made in an active 3D sketch.
The ParamsIn argument in Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is a SafeArray of size (4 + numKnots + numControlPointDoubles) as follows:
[
Dimension, Order, NumControlPoints, Periodicity, knot1, knot2,..., ControlPoint1[Dimension], ControlPoint2[Dimension],...
]
where:
Dimension
,
Order
,
NumControlPoints
, and
Periodicity
are integer values.
The size of the knot array is determined by (
NumControlPoints
+
Order
).
The size of the control point array is based upon the curve dimension:
If
Dimension
= 3, then
ControlPoint
is an array of 3 doubles ( x, y, z ).
If
Dimension
= 4, then
ControlPoint
is an array of 4 doubles ( x, y, z, w ) where w = weight.
